article_title: Safety Problem? Let's Set Up Two Committees
article_text:
Texas billionaire H. Ross Perot once said that where he came from, if you see a snake, you kill it. But at General Motors, if you see snake, you hire a consultant on snakes, then you form a committee on snakes, and then you discuss it for a couple of years.

Mr. Perot delivered that cutting assessment more than 25 years ago. But he could have said it yesterday.

GM Chief Executive Mary Barra, outside lawyers and federal traffic...

twitter.description: The picture that emerges from General Motors's disclosures about events that led to the recent recalls of 1.6 million vehicles is of a company burdened by bureaucratic complexity, and unable to respond decisively.
twitter.creator: @wsjeyesonroad

image.alt: Chevy Cobalt recall suggests GM never lost its love of red tape

twitter.title: A Recall Bares GM's Love of Red Tape

article_summary:
Texas billionaire H. Ross Perot once said that where he came from, if you see a snake, you kill it.
GM Chief Executive Mary Barra, outside lawyers and federal traffic...
But at General Motors, if you see snake, you hire a consultant on snakes, then you form a committee on snakes, and then you discuss it for a couple of years.
Mr. Perot delivered that cutting assessment more than 25 years ago.
But he could have said it yesterday.
